page.title: 19Customs in Hebden Bridge
page.content: There are many customs which take place in Hebden Bridge each year. There are the{Hay Race,}where men carry bales of hay up the Buttress (a cobbled steep hill) to Heptonstall, the{Pace Egg}play at Easter and the {Morris Dancers. Automobilia}is in summer where old cars, vans, and lorries are put on show. The most ineresting custom that happens only in Hebden Bridge and nowhere else in the world is the{Dock Pudding}competition. It is to see who can make the tastiest Dock Pudding. Dock Pudding is made out of Dock leaves. Dock is a wild flower but you use the leaves. You wash them, grind them together and add porridge oats and onions. The{Pace Egg}play takes place each Easter. Lots of people dress up and act the medieval style play of St. George fighting the powers of evil.
